recent.definition: Having happened a short while ago.

year.definition: A solar year, the time it takes the Earth to complete one revolution of the Sun (between 365.24 and 365.26 days depending on the point of reference).

role.definition: A character or part played by a performer or actor.

technology.definition: The organization of knowledge for practical purposes.

education.definition: The process of imparting knowledge, skill and judgment.

expand.definition: To change (something) from a smaller form and/or size to a larger one; to spread out or lay open.

transform.definition: An operation (often an integration) that converts one function into another.

environment.definition: The surroundings of, and influences on, a particular item of interest.

into.definition: To or towards the inside of.

dynamic.definition: A characteristic or manner of an interaction; a behavior.

interactive.definition: A feature (as in a museum) that can be interacted with.

experience.definition: The effect upon the judgment or feelings produced by any event, whether witnessed or participated in; personal and direct impressions as contrasted with description or fancies; personal acquaintance; actual enjoyment or suffering.

integration.definition: The act or process of making whole or entire.

tool.definition: A mechanical device intended to make a task easier.

such.definition: Something being indicated that is similar to something else.

tablet.definition: A slab of clay used for inscription.

educational.definition: A free (or low cost) trip for travel consultants, provided by a travel operator or airline as a means of promoting their service. A fam trip

software.definition: Encoded computer instructions, usually modifiable (unless stored in some form of unalterable memory such as ROM).

revolutionize.definition: To radically or significantly change, as in a revolution

way.definition: (heading) To do with a place or places.

student.definition: A person who studies or learns about a particular subject.

knowledge.definition: The fact of knowing about something; general understanding or familiarity with a subject, place, situation etc.

institution.definition: A custom or practice of a society or community.

embrace.definition: An act of putting arms around someone and bringing the person close to the chest; a hug.

development.definition: The process of developing; growth, directed change.

recognise.definition: To match (something or someone which one currently perceives) to a memory of some previous encounter with the same person or thing.

potential.definition: Currently unrealized ability (with the most common adposition being to)

both.definition: Each of the two, or of the two kinds.

teach.definition: To show (someone) the way; to guide, conduct; to point, indicate.

process.definition: A series of events which produce a result (the product).

educator.definition: A person distinguished for his/her educational work, a teacher.

multimedia.definition: The combined use of sound, video, and text to present an idea.

lesson.definition: A section of learning or teaching into which a wider learning content is divided.

diverse.definition: Consisting of many different elements; various.

style.definition: Senses relating to a thin, pointed object.

great.definition: A person of major significance, accomplishment or acclaim.

engagement.definition: An appointment, especially to speak or perform.

moreover.definition: In addition to what has been said; furthermore; additionally.

rise.definition: To move, or appear to move, physically upwards relative to the ground.

online.definition: To bring (a system, etc.) online; to promote to an active or running state.

platform.definition: A raised stage from which speeches are made and on which musical and other performances are made.

more.definition: To a greater degree or extent.

ever.definition: Occurring at any time, occurring even but once during a timespan.

participate.definition: To join in, to take part, to involve oneself (in something).

university.definition: Institution of higher education (typically accepting students from the age of about 17 or 18, depending on country, but in some exceptional cases able to take younger students) where subjects are studied and researched in depth and degrees are offered.

without.definition: Outside, externally. This is still used in the names of some civil parishes in England, e.g. St Cuthbert Without.

need.definition: A requirement for something; something needed.

relocate.definition: To move (something) from one place to another.

attend.definition: To listen to (something or someone); to pay attention to; regard; heed.

class.definition: A group, collection, category or set sharing characteristics or attributes.

person.definition: An individual; usually a human being.

this.definition: Something being indicated that is here; one of these.

flexibility.definition: The quality of being flexible; suppleness; pliability.

allow.definition: To grant, give, admit, accord, afford, or yield; to let one have.

balance.definition: A state in which opposing forces harmonise; equilibrium.

study.definition: (usually academic) To review materials already learned in order to make sure one does not forget them, usually in preparation for an examination.

personal.definition: An advertisement by which individuals attempt to meet others with similar interests.

professional.definition: A person who belongs to a profession

commitment.definition: The act or an instance of committing, putting in charge, keeping, or trust, especially:

broad.definition: A shallow lake, one of a number of bodies of water in eastern Norfolk and Suffolk.

audience.definition: A group of people within hearing; specifically, a large gathering of people listening to or watching a performance, speech, etc.

access.definition: A way or means of approaching or entering; an entrance; a passage.

empower.definition: To give permission, power, or the legal right to do something.

take.definition: The or an act of taking.

charge.definition: The amount of money levied for a service.

pathway.definition: A footpath or other path or track.

plethora.definition: (usually followed by of) An excessive amount or number; an abundance.

resource.definition: Something that one uses to achieve an objective, e.g. raw materials or personnel.

available.definition: Such as one may avail oneself of; capable of being used for the accomplishment of a purpose.

fingertip.definition: The tip of the human finger.

however.definition: Nevertheless; yet, still; in spite of (that).

shift.definition: A modifier key whose main function is shifting between two or more functions of any of certain other keys (usually by pressing Shift and the other button simultaneously).

concern.definition: That which affects one’s welfare or happiness. A matter of interest to someone. The adposition before the matter of interest is usually over, about or for.

screen.definition: A physical divider intended to block an area from view, or provide shelter from something dangerous.

time.definition: The inevitable progression into the future with the passing of present and past events.

reduce.definition: To bring down the size, quantity, quality, value or intensity of something; to diminish, to lower.

years.definition: A solar year, the time it takes the Earth to complete one revolution of the Sun (between 365.24 and 365.26 days depending on the point of reference).

expanded.definition: To change (something) from a smaller form and/or size to a larger one; to spread out or lay open.

transforming.definition: To change greatly the appearance or form of.

learning.definition: To acquire, or attempt to acquire knowledge or an ability to do something.

environments.definition: The surroundings of, and influences on, a particular item of interest.

experiences.definition: The effect upon the judgment or feelings produced by any event, whether witnessed or participated in; personal and direct impressions as contrasted with description or fancies; personal acquaintance; actual enjoyment or suffering.

tools.definition: A mechanical device intended to make a task easier.

tablets.definition: A slab of clay used for inscription.

revolutionized.definition: To radically or significantly change, as in a revolution

students.definition: A person who studies or learns about a particular subject.

institutions.definition: A custom or practice of a society or community.

embracing.definition: To clasp (someone or each other) in the arms with affection; to take in the arms; to hug.

developments.definition: The process of developing; growth, directed change.

recognising.definition: To match (something or someone which one currently perceives) to a memory of some previous encounter with the same person or thing.

teaching.definition: Something taught by a religious or philosophical authority.

processes.definition: A series of events which produce a result (the product).

educators.definition: A person distinguished for his/her educational work, a teacher.

lessons.definition: A section of learning or teaching into which a wider learning content is divided.

styles.definition: Senses relating to a thin, pointed object.

fostering.definition: To nurture or bring up offspring, or to provide similar parental care to an unrelated child.

greater.definition: Relatively large in scale, size, extent, number (i.e. having many parts or members) or duration (i.e. relatively long); very big.

platforms.definition: A raised stage from which speeches are made and on which musical and other performances are made.

universities.definition: Institution of higher education (typically accepting students from the age of about 17 or 18, depending on country, but in some exceptional cases able to take younger students) where subjects are studied and researched in depth and degrees are offered.

classes.definition: A group, collection, category or set sharing characteristics or attributes.

allows.definition: To grant, give, admit, accord, afford, or yield; to let one have.

studies.definition: An academic field of study concerning the given subject.

commitments.definition: The act or an instance of committing, putting in charge, keeping, or trust, especially:

making.definition: The act of forming, causing, or constituting; workmanship; construction.

empowers.definition: To give permission, power, or the legal right to do something.

pathways.definition: A footpath or other path or track.

resources.definition: Something that one uses to achieve an objective, e.g. raw materials or personnel.

fingertips.definition: The tip of the human finger.

concerns.definition: That which affects one’s welfare or happiness. A matter of interest to someone. The adposition before the matter of interest is usually over, about or for.

reduced.definition: To bring down the size, quantity, quality, value or intensity of something; to diminish, to lower.

interactions.definition: The situation or occurrence in which two or more objects or events act upon one another to produce a new effect; the effect resulting from such a situation or occurrence.

raised.definition: (physical) To cause to rise; to lift or elevate.

parents.definition: One of the two persons from whom one is immediately biologically descended; a mother or father.

alike.definition: Having resemblance or similitude; similar; without difference.

ongoing.definition: To be ongoing (occurring, happening); to last, proceed or continue.

debate.definition: An argument, or discussion, usually in an ordered or formal setting, often with more than two people, generally ending with a vote or other decision.

effectiveness.definition: The property of being effective, of achieving results.

virtual.definition: A virtual member function of a class.

compared.definition: To assess the similarities and differences between two or more things ["to compare X with Y"]. Having made the comparison of X with Y, one might have found it similar to Y or different from Y.

classroom.definition: A room, often in a school, where classes take place

settings.definition: The time, place and circumstance in which something (such as a story or picture) is set; context; scenario.

suggest.definition: To imply but stop short of saying explicitly.

that.definition: Something being indicated that is there; one of those.

improve.definition: To make (something) better; to increase the value or productivity (of something).

retention.definition: The act of retaining or something retained

understanding.definition: To grasp a concept fully and thoroughly, especially (of words, statements, art, etc.) to be aware of the meaning of and (of people) to be aware of the intent of.

others.definition: An other, another (person, etc), more often rendered as another.

argue.definition: To show grounds for concluding (that); to indicate, imply.

lack.definition: A defect or failing; moral or spiritual degeneracy.

presence.definition: The fact or condition of being present, or of being within sight or call, or at hand.

hinder.definition: To make difficult to accomplish; to act as an obstacle; to frustrate.

social.definition: A festive gathering to foster introductions.

crucial.definition: Essential or decisive for determining the outcome or future of something; extremely important.

communication.definition: The act or fact of communicating anything; transmission.

striking.definition: (sometimes with out or through) To delete or cross out; to scratch or eliminate.

methods.definition: A process by which a task is completed; a way of doing something (followed by the adposition of, to or for before the purpose of the process):

maximise.definition: To make as large as possible

benefits.definition: An advantage; help or aid from something.

approaches.definition: The act of drawing near; a coming or advancing near.

significant.definition: That which has significance; a sign; a token; a symbol.

implementation.definition: The process of moving an idea from concept to reality. In business, engineering and other fields, implementation refers to the building process rather than the design process.

all.definition: (with a possessive pronoun) Everything that one is capable of.

necessary.definition: (usually with the definite article) A place to do the "necessary" business of urination and defecation: an outhouse or lavatory.

devices.definition: Any piece of equipment made for a particular purpose, especially a mechanical or electrical one.

reliable.definition: Something or someone reliable or dependable

internet.definition: Any set of computer networks that communicate using the Internet Protocol. (An intranet.)

underprivileged.definition: A deprived person; deprived people (normally used as a plural).

rural.definition: A person from the countryside; a rustic.

areas.definition: A measure of the extent of a surface; it is measured in square units.

disparity.definition: The state of being unequal; difference.

exacerbate.definition: To make worse (a problem, bad situation, negative feeling, etc.); aggravate; exasperate.

existing.definition: (stative) to be; have existence; have being or reality

outcomes.definition: That which is produced or occurs as a result of an event or process.

leaving.definition: To have a consequence or remnant.

disadvantage.definition: A weakness or undesirable characteristic; a con.

policymakers.definition: One involved in the formulation of policies, especially politicians, lobbyists, and activists.

leaders.definition: Any person that leads or directs

must.definition: Something that is mandatory or required.

issues.definition: The action or an instance of flowing or coming out, an outflow, particularly:

ensuring.definition: To make a pledge to (someone); to promise, guarantee (someone of something); to assure.

benefit.definition: An advantage; help or aid from something.

technological.definition: Of, relating to, or involving technology, especially modern scientific technology.

advancements.definition: The act of advancing, ; promotion to a higher place or dignity

aimed.definition: To point or direct a missile, or a weapon which propels as missile, towards an object or spot with the intent of hitting it

providing.definition: To make a living; earn money for necessities.

furthermore.definition: In addition; besides; what's more; used to denote additional information.

evolving.definition: To move in regular procession through a system.

response.definition: An answer or reply, or something in the nature of an answer or reply.

teachers.definition: A person who teaches, especially one employed in a school.

required.definition: To ask (someone) for something; to request.

adept.definition: One fully skilled or well versed in anything; a proficient

subject.definition: Likely to be affected by or to experience something.

integrating.definition: To form into one whole; to make entire; to complete; to renew; to restore; to perfect.

effectively.definition: In an efficient or effective manner; with powerful effect.

curricula.definition: The set of courses, coursework, and their content, offered at a school or university.

focus.definition: A point at which reflected or refracted rays of light converge.

helping.definition: To provide assistance to (someone or something).

pedagogical.definition: Of, or relating to pedagogy; teaching.

strategies.definition: The science and art of military command as applied to the overall planning and conduct of warfare.

they.definition: (the third-person plural) A group of people, animals, plants or objects previously mentioned.

navigate.definition: To plan, control and record the position and course of a vehicle, ship, aircraft, etc., on a journey; to follow a planned course.

transition.definition: The process of change from one form, state, style or place to another.

create.definition: To bring into existence; (sometimes in particular:)

harness.definition: A restraint or support, especially one consisting of a loop or network of rope or straps.

power.definition: Ability to do or undergo something.

maintaining.definition: To support (someone), to back up or assist (someone) in an action.

elements.definition: One of the simplest or essential parts or principles of which anything consists, or upon which the constitution or fundamental powers of anything are based.

looking.definition: The act of one who looks; a glance.

future.definition: The time ahead; those moments yet to be experienced.

appears.definition: To come or be in sight; to be in view; to become visible.

promising.definition: To commit to (some action or outcome), or to assure (a person) of such commitment; to make an oath or vow.

innovations.definition: The act of innovating; the introduction of something new, in customs, rites, etc.

intelligence.definition: Capacity of mind, especially to understand principles, truths, facts or meanings, acquire knowledge, and apply it to practice; the ability to comprehend and learn.

reality.definition: The state of being actual or real.

gamification.definition: The use of gameplay mechanics for non-game applications.

reshape.definition: To make into a different shape

landscapes.definition: A portion of land or territory which the eye can comprehend in a single view, including all the objects it contains.

unprecedented.definition: Never before seen, done, or experienced; without precedent.

ways.definition: (heading) To do with a place or places.

continues.definition: An option allowing a gamer to resume play after game over, when all lives have been lost.

develop.definition: To change with a specific direction, progress.

will.definition: (now uncommon or literary) To wish, desire (something).

systems.definition: A collection of organized things; a whole composed of relationships among its members.

adapt.definition: To make suitable; to make to correspond; to fit or suit

evolve.definition: To move in regular procession through a system.

generation.definition: The fact of creating something, or bringing something into being; production, creation.

equipped.definition: To supply with something necessary in order to carry out a specific action or task; to provide with (e.g. weapons, provisions, munitions, rigging)

thrive.definition: To grow or increase stature; to grow vigorously or luxuriantly, to flourish.

world.definition: (with "the") Human collective existence; existence in general.

conclusion.definition: The end, finish, close or last part of something.

influence.definition: The power to affect, control or manipulate something or someone; the ability to change the development of fluctuating things such as conduct, thoughts or decisions.

modern.definition: Someone who lives in modern times.

profound.definition: The deep; the sea; the ocean.

offers.definition: A proposal that has been made.

remarkable.definition: Worthy of being remarked or noted; notable

opportunities.definition: A chance for advancement, progress or profit.

accessibility.definition: The quality of being accessible, or of admitting approach; receptiveness.

presents.definition: The current moment or period of time.

ensure.definition: To make a pledge to (someone); to promise, guarantee (someone of something); to assure.

communities.definition: A group sharing a common understanding, and often the same language, law, manners, and/or tradition.

remaining.definition: To stay behind while others withdraw; to be left after others have been removed or destroyed; to be left after a number or quantity has been subtracted or cut off; to be left as not included or comprised.

limitations.definition: The act of limiting or the state of being limited.

balanced.definition: To bring (items) to an equipoise, as the scales of a balance by adjusting the weights.

approach.definition: The act of drawing near; a coming or advancing near.

preparing.definition: To make ready for a specific future purpose; to set up; to assemble or equip.

success.definition: The achievement of one's aim or goal.

driven.definition: To provide an impetus for motion or other physical change, to move an object by means of the provision of force thereto.

society.definition: A long-standing group of people sharing cultural aspects such as language, dress, norms of behavior and artistic forms.

contribution.definition: Something given or offered that adds to a larger whole.

undergone.definition: To go or move under or beneath.

altered.definition: To change the form or structure of.

conventional.definition: A conventional gilt-edged security, a kind of bond paying the holder a fixed cash payment (or coupon) every six months until maturity, at which point the holder receives the final payment and the return of the principal.

transformation.definition: The act of transforming or the state of being transformed.

across.definition: (crosswords, often in combination) A word that runs horizontally in the completed puzzle grid or its associated clue.

adopt.definition: To take by choice into relationship (a child, heir, friend, citizen, etc.)

emergence.definition: The act of rising out of a fluid, or coming forth from envelopment or concealment, or of rising into view; sudden uprising or appearance.

significantly.definition: In a significant manner or to a significant extent.

increased.definition: (of a quantity, etc.) To become larger or greater.

educations.definition: The process of imparting knowledge, skill and judgment.

allowing.definition: To grant, give, admit, accord, afford, or yield; to let one have.

pursue.definition: To follow urgently, originally with intent to capture or harm; to chase.

attendance.definition: The state of attending; presence or waiting upon.

advantages.definition: Any condition, circumstance, opportunity or means, particularly favorable to success, or to any desired end.

arisen.definition: To come up from a lower to a higher position.

gap.definition: An opening in anything made by breaking or parting.

underserved.definition: To supply something with insufficient services or resources.

contributes.definition: To give something that is or becomes part of a larger whole.

results.definition: That which results; the conclusion or end to which any course or condition of things leads, or which is obtained by any process or operation; consequence or effect.
